msgSnippet: That was the problem.  For the record, I am using a Forte, Ant, JUnit combination.  I replaced junit.jar in forte4j/lib/ext with the 3.8.1 jar and that solved

That was the problem.  For the record, I am using a Forte, Ant, JUnit combi=
nation.  I replaced junit.jar in forte4j/lib/ext with the 3.8.1 jar and tha=
t solved the problem.


Dave

> 
> 	A batch of us just had=
 the same problem here when running tests
> through an Ant script. The prob=
lem seems to have been caused 
> by having two
> different versions of the =
JUnit jar in the classpath (ours 
> was once in our
> system classpath, and=
 once specified in the Ant classpath). Check your
> classpaths and ensure t=
hat you don't have multiple references 
> to junit.jar
> in there. 
> 
> 	-=
tim
